questions.text: Child at birth appeared short. Out of the following which child has best prognosis for growth after birth?

options.label: B
options.text: Baby with birth length and weight is less than 10th percentile

options.label: C
options.text: Baby born to parents who are themselves below the 3rd percentile

options.label: D
options.text: Baby with birth length, weight and head circumference is less than 10th percentile

questions.correct_answer: D. Baby with birth length, weight and head circumference is less than 10th percentile

questions.text: Child is diagnosed as having Celiac disease. He is HLA-DQ-2 positive and antiendomysial antibodies are present. Out of the following which of the following statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: At birth weight is less than expected

options.label: C
options.text: Linear growth velocity is not affected

questions.correct_answer: B. Weight gain falls after 6 months

questions.text: Catch down growth involves a period of slow growth that follows a phase where baby experienced rapid or extreme growth above normal range. Out of the following example of catch down growth is:

options.label: A
options.text: Child losing weight in first 6 months of life due to bottle feeding

options.label: B
options.text: Child born as large for gestational age and now crosses to a lower centile line

options.label: C
options.text: Due to malabsorption the child is not gaining weight

options.label: D
options.text: Due to growth hormone deficiency there is decreased linear growth

questions.correct_answer: B. Child born as large for gestational age and now crosses to a lower centile line

questions.text: 7 year old child has history of recurrent wheeze and nocturnal cough. There is family history of allergic rhinitis. Which of the following statements is true regarding this condition in child:

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in peak expiratory flow rate

options.label: C
options.text: Mast cell stabiliser can be used as prophylaxis

questions.correct_answer: B. Decrease in peak expiratory flow rate

questions.text: At birth, in neonate screening for congenital heart disease is done. Which of the following statements is correct regarding congenital heart disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Measurement of oxygen saturation can detect all congenital heart defects

options.label: B
options.text: Normally murmur can be present at birth due to patent ductus arteriosus which disappears in 24 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Normal chest X-ray at birth excludes congenital heart disease

options.label: D
options.text: Babies having cyanotic congenital heart disease always appear blue at birth

questions.correct_answer: B. Normally murmur can be present at birth due to patent ductus arteriosus which disappears in 24 hours

questions.text: Child is having vomiting with no signs of dehydration. There is no fever and no history of diarrhea. Which of the following states is true regarding vomiting in children?

options.label: A
options.text: Vomiting can be a sign of increased intracranial pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Projectile vomiting is diagnostic of pyloric stenosis

options.label: C
options.text: Antibiotics are given in viral gastroenteritis

options.label: D
options.text: Presence of green coloured vomiting in newborn is a sign of gastroesophageal reflex

questions.correct_answer: A. Vomiting can be a sign of increased intracranial pressure

questions.text: In child diagnosed as ventricular septal defect there is presence of pan systolic murmur at lower left sternal border. In this child there can be enlargement of all heart chambers except:
While evaluating for neurological disorders in children which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Delayed walking is always caused by muscle weakness

options.label: B
options.text: Cranial nerves can be checked only above 5 years of age

options.label: C
options.text: In spastic form of cerebral palsy, the plantar grasp persists more than normal

options.label: D
options.text: Duchene muscular dystrophy can affect both males and females

questions.correct_answer: C. In spastic form of cerebral palsy, the plantar grasp persists more than normal

questions.text: Child is being assessed for motor development. Out of the following which is a sign of abnormal gross motor development:

options.label: A
options.text: Climbing up stairs and down stairs at 2 years of age

options.label: B
options.text: Changing prone to supine position at 5-6 months of age

options.label: C
options.text: Crawling at the age of 18 months

options.label: D
options.text: Pedalling a tricycle at the age of 3 years

questions.correct_answer: C. Crawling at the age of 18 months

questions.text: Child is having weight for height < -3 Z score and mid upper arm circumference 11.0 cm. according to WHO classification this child is called as:
To prevent Down syndrome in child, screening test should be done in all pregnancy. Which of the following is true regarding screening in Down’s syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Done by measurement of hormone & proteins in the maternal serum

options.label: B
options.text: Done by measurement of hormone & proteins in the amniotic fluid

options.label: C
options.text: If risk ration is 1:500, then termination of pregnancy is done

options.label: D
options.text: Couple with already child with Down’s syndrome first screening is done in next pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: A. Done by measurement of hormone & proteins in the maternal serum

questions.text: Regarding the inheritance of autosomal dominant disorders which of the following is true:

options.label: A
options.text: 50% of the offspring will be affected

options.label: B
options.text: Males are affected more than females

options.label: D
options.text: More common in cousin – cousin marriages

questions.correct_answer: A. 50% of the offspring will be affected

questions.text: Term child was discharged 24 hours after birth. On day 3 parents notice yellowing of skin of face. Child is accepting feeds well. Next step in this child is:

options.label: A
options.text: Sepsis screen to be done to rule out sepsis

options.label: C
options.text: Place the child in sunlight at home

questions.correct_answer: D. Bilirubin level should be measured

questions.text: 6 months old male child has history of increased sweating and is salty on kissing the child. All of the following findings can be seen in this child except:

options.label: B
options.text: Increased incidence of respiratory tract infection

questions.text: 4 years old child has swelling all over the body, which is more in morning and decreases till evening. In this child on measurement serum complement C3 is normal. All of the following findings can be seen except:

options.label: C
options.text: Requires pneumococcal vaccination when in remission

questions.text: A elderly female sustained Colles’ fracture in her right hand which was properly treated. She now complains of stiffness and severe pain in the wrist with cold sensation and cyanosis in the fingers. X-ray of the hand revealed complete decalcification. She is most likely suffering from –

A 42 year old female presents with tingling and numbness in right hand that awakens her in the middle of the night for last two weeks. She also gives history of being treated for diabetes and hypothyroidism for last 3 years by an endocrinologist. Which of the following ain’t true about this condition from the following options ?

options.label: A
options.text: Splintage is helpful only in few initial months of onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Durakn’s Test is the most specific clinical test in the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most common focal compression neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: B. Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

questions.text: A 25 year old soccer player complained of injury to right knee 6 months ago. Now he says that there is a feeling of sudden giving away of knee joint with knee in 90 degree flexion which completely disappears when the knee is taken into complete extension. Which of the following ligament needs to be checked ?

A 12 year old boy has been complaining of pain and swelling in his right thigh. He has associated fever as well. He was taken to a doctor where blood markers were done which show raised TLC , ESR and CRP. He is put on IV antibiotics and NSAID. He responds to the medicines till the time he takes them but then symptoms occur again when he stops. X-ray was done which shows laminated periosteal reaction along the diaphysis of femur. Which of the following will be the most conclusive investigation to establish the diagnosis ?
Which of the following is seen in osteoporosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Calcium normal and ALP normal

questions.text: All of the following are not true about suicide except?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient who talk about suicide rarely commit suicide

options.label: B
options.text: All suicidal threats are not to be taken seriously

options.label: C
options.text: Asking about suicide will often reduce the anxiety surrounding the feeling

options.label: D
options.text: Amongst all risk factors of suicide, hopelessness is most important risk factor

questions.correct_answer: C. Asking about suicide will often reduce the anxiety surrounding the feeling

questions.text: In MMSE (Mini Mental Status examination), highest score is given to which one of the following domains tested?

A 30-year-old man was brought to the Accident and Emergency Department. He suddenly fell down after hearing a loud sound at a party. There was no loss of consciousness. The psychopathology being described is:
Which of the following is not a REM sleep disorder?

A 60-year-old woman complained of depression and was started on escitalopram. After two weeks of treatment, she complains of lethargy, muscle weakness and nausea. Which of the following is the most likely cause for her symptoms:
Identify the marked structure
Identify the marked structure Which view includes the most breast tissue?
Linear accelerator for

Identify the finding seen:
Which of these structures is anechoic?
What's the most likely diagnosis? 51 ear old with abdominal pain
A 7 week pregnant lady accidentally underwent a CXR, what would you advise her.
37-year-old female patient who is HIV positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following does not cause urethritis in male?
A-18-year old boy has asymptomatic dome shaped small lesion on forehead for last 2 months. He has a 12-year old sibling with similar lesion. What is the causative agent?
A young man presents with asymptomatic macules on trunk and painless lesion on glans penis with generalized lymphadenopathy. The treatment of choice is?
A 6 month old male infant developed otitis media. A few days later, he developed extensive peeling of the skin. There were no mucosal lesions. The most likely diagnosis?
Identify the simple bedside procedure shown in the picture.

A patient is experiencing a symptomatic new wide complex QRS rhythm that is unstable. Cardioversion is indicated. He has a high ASA risk score (unstable uncontrolled ischemic heart disease and diabetes) with a Mallampati score of 2. What is the most appropriate sedative agent for this patient?

A 59-year-old woman was undergoing surgery to remove a breast cancer. The anesthesia was induced by thiopental, maintained by isoflurane and supplemented with a nondepolarizing neuromuscular blocker which has a short duration of action and is metabolized by plasma pseudocholinesterase. Which of the following drugs was most likely administered?

A 37-year-old female is scheduled for an elective laparoscopic hysterectomy. Induction was performed using 140 mg propofol and 100 mcg fentanyl with subsequent 70 mg rocuronium. After intubation, anesthesia was rapidly maintained with an inhaled anesthetic. Within the first minute of administering the inhaled anesthetic, the patient’s heart rate decreased from 70 beats per minute to 50 beats per minute, and the blood pressure decreased from 130/70 mmHg to 80\48 mmHg. Which of the following inhalation agents was most likely used to induce the above response?

A 31-year-old patient with a past history for asthma presented to the ER with difficulty in breathing and cough. Examination shows that he was using accessory muscles and lung auscultation showed extensive expiratory wheezing. Labs and chest x-ray were unremarkable. He did not respond to nebulizations, steroids, and IV magnesium treatment. He was put on non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (BiPAP) by an ER physician which again he didn't tolerate. Eventually, he was intubated and to achieve better patient-ventilator synchrony he was deeply sedated. The second day in ICU his wheezing is much better. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Sedation vacation and spontaneous breathing trial

options.label: D
options.text: Do a spontaneous breathing trial on sedative medications.

questions.correct_answer: B. Sedation vacation and spontaneous breathing trial

questions.text: Which of the following systems prevents attachment of gas-administering equipment to the wrong type of gas line?
Which of the following is not a manifestation of vitamin B1 deficiency?
What is the first-line treatment for acute symptomatic hyponatremia associated with cerebral edema or neurological symptoms?
Which of the following clinical feature is not commonly associated with hypocalcemia?

What is the term used to describe the obliteration of the diamond-shaped space normally seen when opposing the dorsal surfaces of the nails of the corresponding fingers in individuals with finger clubbing?
What is the initial step in the management of a stable patient presenting with mild hemoptysis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Chest X ray and evaluation

questions.text: Which additional sign might be present on auscultation of a patient with bacterial pneumonia involving the pleura?
In the context of the patient's PFT findings, what does a FVC of 72% of predicted indicate?
Which occupational group has the highest risk of developing asbestosis due to exposure to asbestos?
In patient with HFrEF, what additional intervention might be considered to reduce symptoms and hospitalizations, especially with persistent symptoms despite optimal medical therapy?

A 55-year-old male presents to the emergency department with severe chest pain that started 5 hours ago. He describes the pain as crushing, located in the center of his chest, radiating to his left arm. The patient has a history of hypertension and dyslipidemia. ECG showing ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Cardiac troponin levels are elevated. What is the most appropriate initial management for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate coronary angiography followed by PCI

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate coronary angiography followed by PCI

questions.text: Which class of antihypertensive medication is often recommended as initial therapy for patients with hypertension and diabetes with chronic kidney disease?
Which maneuver during physical examination can accentuate the intensity of the murmur in mitral stenosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Standing up from a squatting position

questions.text: What is the minimum number of major criteria required for the diagnosis of acute rheumatic fever according to the Jones Criteria?
questions.correct_answer: B. At least two major criteria

questions.text: A 45-year-old male presents to the emergency room with complaints of fever, fatigue, and shortness of breath. The patient reports a history of a dental procedure performed two weeks ago. On examination, a new-onset murmur is detected on cardiac auscultation, and small, painless, red, non-tender nodules are noted on the fingers. What is the most likely diagnosis based on the clinical presentation and findings in this patient?

A 32-year-old female presents to the emergency room with rapidly progressive weakness and tingling sensations in her legs that ascended to her trunk within a few hours. She reports having had a respiratory infection 4 weeks ago. On examination, she demonstrates flaccid paralysis of the lower extremities and absent deep tendon reflexes. What is the most likely diagnosis based on the clinical presentation described?
Besides thrombolytic therapy, what other acute treatment strategy is often employed in eligible patients with large vessel occlusion ischemic stroke?

A 25-year-old female presents to the emergency department with a severe headache, fever, and neck stiffness. The patient reports feeling generally unwell and experiencing photophobia. On examination, the patient has a high fever, nuchal rigidity, positive Brudzinski's and Kernig's signs, and a petechial rash on the trunk.Based on the clinical presentation described, what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male presents to the neurology clinic with a history of progressive involuntary movements and behavioural changes. He reports experiencing uncontrolled jerking movements in his arms and face for the past few years. His family also notes personality changes, including irritability and depression. On examination, the patient demonstrates choreiform movements and difficulties with coordination. What is the most likely diagnosis based on the clinical presentation described?

A 45-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of fatigue, joint pain, and abdominal discomfort. He reports a history of diabetes and cirrhosis in his father. Physical examination reveals hepatomegaly and skin hyperpigmentation. Laboratory tests show elevated serum ferritin levels, increased transferrin saturation, and mildly elevated liver enzymes. What is the most likely diagnosis based on the clinical presentation described?
In a patient presenting with acute Hepatitis B infection, which serological marker can be detected during the window period, after the disappearance of HBsAg and before the appearance of Anti-HBs?
What is the most common joint manifestation seen in patients with Ulcerative Colitis?
In PSGN, which glomerular pathology is typically observed on renal biopsy?
Which autoantibody is particularly associated with neonatal lupus and can cause heart block in the foetus?
What is the hallmark clinical manifestation of Henoch-Schönlein Purpura (HSP)?
What is the classic triad of symptoms observed in Wegener's granulomatosis (Granulomatosis with polyangiitis)?

options.label: A
options.text: Skin rash, fever, and joint pain

options.label: B
options.text: Nasal ulcers, lower respiratory tract involvement, and glomerulonephritis

options.label: C
options.text: Migratory arthritis, abdominal pain, and peripheral neuropathy

options.label: D
options.text: Oral ulcers, conjunctivitis, and genital ulcers

questions.correct_answer: B. Nasal ulcers, lower respiratory tract involvement, and glomerulonephritis

questions.text: What should be the total sodium to be given in first 24 hours (in mmol) for a 70 kg male patient with serum sodium at presentation 120 mmol/L.

In a hospital a study was planned to know the association of folic acid consumption and neural tube defects. 600 pregnant women visiting for ante natal care were included in the study and were asked about daily folic acid consumption. 40% women said they are consuming folic acid tablets. At the end of the study, 30% babies of those women who were not consuming folic acid developed neural tube defects and 10% babies of women who were consuming developed neural tube defects. Which of the following best describes the about the study designs?
A 40 year old man had a dog bite 10 months back and he got all scheduled post exposure vaccination. Now he is complaining of monkey bite. Which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Start post exposure rabies vaccination on 0,3,7, 28 id route (as it is monkey bite now, not dog bite)

options.label: B
options.text: Start equine immunoglobulin 20IU/kg, no need of vaccination

options.label: C
options.text: Start vaccination 1 site, 1 dose i.m. or 2 doses i.d. (day 0 & 3).

options.label: D
options.text: No need of vaccine and immunoglobulins

questions.correct_answer: C. Start vaccination 1 site, 1 dose i.m. or 2 doses i.d. (day 0 & 3).

questions.text: The lesion shown in the image is shown in which of the following disease?
According to the image given

options.label: A
options.text: Low BP in childhood tend to remain low in adulthood

options.label: B
options.text: Low BP in childhood tend to remain high in adulthood

options.label: C
options.text: High BP in childhood tend to remain low in adulthood

questions.correct_answer: A. Low BP in childhood tend to remain low in adulthood

questions.text: A study was planned on patients in rehabilitation to know impact of addiction among young adults were assessed on their subsequent divorce. Among 2 groups of study subjects, divorced and non- divorced, history of alcohol/ drug use was assessed. What kind of study was done?

A 55-year-old shipyard worker is referred by his general practitioner (GP) to the Ear, Nose, and Throat (ENT) clinic for a lump in the anterior triangle of his neck. The firm 2 cm by 2 cm mass seems to be fixed to the underlying tissue and moves with swallowing but not with tongue protrusion. Which of the following is true of fi ne-needle aspiration (FNA) of this lesion?

options.label: A
options.text: A FNA sample containing colloid is suggestive of malignancy

options.label: B
options.text: A FNA sample containing follicular cells is suggestive of malignancy

options.label: C
options.text: FNA is useful in the diagnosis of papillary carcinoma

options.label: D
options.text: FNA is useful in the exclusion of follicular malignancyFF

questions.correct_answer: C. FNA is useful in the diagnosis of papillary carcinoma

questions.text: The given image shows methylene blue being injected in the peritumoral region. Which of the given procedure is being performed?

A 19-year-old man is brought to the Emergency Department after being found unconscious outside a pub. On examination he has a GCS of 3 with a blood pressure of 116/84 mmHg and pulse rate of 94/min. He smells heavily of alcohol. He is noted to have bilateral periorbital haematomas and bruising over the right mastoid process. There appears to be serosanguinous discharge from his right nostril and right ear. Otoscopic examination of the right ear reveals blood behind the tympanic membrane. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

options.label: A

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman was found to have carcinoma cervix. FIGO stage is 3B . What is the management?
